macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Markets Mixed Close on Friday with Dow Down 0.6%
items.summary: The S&P 500 edged up 0.04% to 6,915.61, Nasdaq rose 0.3% to 23,501.24, while Dow Jones fell 285 points or 0.58% to 49,098.71 amid cautious trading following geopolitical tensions and tariff threats. Sectors like financials and health underperformed, with Intel tumbling significantly.

items.title: US500 and Other Indices Show Modest Declines on January 23
items.summary: US500 closed at around 6,907-6,917 with a 0.09% drop in one session but slight gain in another; Dow opened 0.44% lower, US2000 down 1.80%. Monthly decline of 0.36% but up 13.21% year-over-year.

items.title: Market Summary: DJIA -0.53%, S&P 500 -0.35% for Week
items.summary: DJIA ended at 49,098.71 (-0.53% weekly), S&P 500 at 6,915.61 (-0.35% weekly), reflecting a zigzag week punctuated by threats of tariffs on Europe and easing geopolitical tensions.

items.title: Corporate Highlights: Clorox Acquires GOJO for $2.25B, CSX Gains Despite Weak Earnings
items.summary: Clorox rose 1.1% after announcing $2.25 billion cash acquisition of Purell maker GOJO Industries; CSX climbed 2.4% on positive 2026 operating profit forecast despite weaker-than-expected profit.

items.title: Treasury Yields Dip, Gold Hits Record, Dollar Weakens
items.summary: 10-year Treasury yield fell to 4.23%; gold prices rose to another record; US dollar weakened against yen and Swiss franc amid bond market swings and tariff threat reactions.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Crypto Market Faces $303 Million in Liquidations Over 24 Hours
items.summary: The cryptocurrency market saw $303 million in liquidations affecting 105,156 traders in the past 24 hours, with $149 million liquidated in the last hour alone, predominantly shorts at $146 million. The largest single liquidation was $30.38 million on Hyperliquid's ETH-USD pair.

items.title: CZ Predicts Bitcoin 'Super-Cycle' in 2026 Breaking Historic Pattern
items.summary: Binance founder Changpeng Zhao forecasts Bitcoin entering a super-cycle in 2026 due to pro-crypto US policies disrupting the traditional four-year halving cycle. Bitcoin trades near $90,866 with support at $88,000 amid bearish technicals.

items.title: Ethereum Whales Add $1 Billion as Price Stabilizes Near $2,950
items.summary: Ethereum has bounced from a 15.6% correction to $2,950, with whales accumulating $1 billion; on-chain metrics show OBV divergence and Ethereum reclaiming No. 2 in daily unique addresses among Layer-1s. This signals recovering network usage despite price below recent highs.

items.title: Dormant Bitcoin Supply Awakens, Testing Market Liquidity with ETF Outflows
items.summary: Over 1.6 million dormant BTC have moved since 2024, equating to $150-160 billion at current prices, alongside $700 million in Bitcoin ETF outflows, increasing liquidity and volatility. Short-term holders are absorbing supply, potentially leading to consolidation before trend resumption.

items.title: Vitalik Buterin Announces Exit from Centralized Social Media in 2026
items.summary: Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin plans to leave centralized social media platforms behind in 2026 amid broader market resets. This coincides with Bitcoin dipping below $88,000 in its biggest sell-off of the year.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: GoodData Launches MCP Server for Safe AI Analytics Execution
items.summary: GoodData announced the launch of an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that allows AI agents to programmatically access governed analytics, metrics, semantic models, and dashboards while maintaining data governance and permissions.

items.title: Qrvey Launches Ready-to-Use AI Features
items.summary: Qrvey has launched ready-to-use AI features to enhance analytics capabilities.

items.title: GEP Named Leader in 2026 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Source-to-Pay Suites with Agentic AI Platform
items.summary: GEP was again placed in the Leaders Quadrant of the 2026 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Source-to-Pay Suites, highlighting its agentic AI platform GEP Qi designed for autonomous procurement and supply chains.

items.title: Yoshua Bengio Warns of AI Power Concentration Risks at Davos 2026
items.summary: AI pioneer Yoshua Bengio cautioned at ET@Davos 2026 that concentration of AI power poses significant global risks, shifting from code development to control.

items.title: AI Demand to Drive $600B Big Five Investment in GPUs and Data Centers by 2026
items.summary: The Big Five tech companies are projected to invest $600B in GPUs and data centers by 2026 due to surging AI demand, straining power grids and boosting nuclear energy interest.

items.title: Precisely Study: AI Confidence Outpaces Data Readiness
items.summary: Precisely's annual study reveals organizations' high AI confidence is hindered by persistent data integrity, quality, lineage, and governance gaps.

items.title: Gartner Predicts 40% of Enterprise Apps to Embed Agentic AI by 2026
items.summary: Gartner forecasts that by 2026, 40% of enterprise applications will incorporate purpose-built AI agents for proactive workflow orchestration, with rapid adoption in high-stakes sectors.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Highguard On Track for January 26 Release Despite Marketing Silence
items.summary: The free-to-play hero shooter Highguard is confirmed for January 26 release on PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X/S. Recent Steam activity shows active development despite weeks of minimal marketing communication from developer Wildlight Entertainment.

items.title: Nintendo Direct Showcase Announced for January 25, Focused on Super Mario Galaxy Movie
items.summary: Nintendo confirmed a Nintendo Direct presentation for January 25, 2026, but it will exclusively cover The Super Mario Galaxy Movie with no game announcements. The first game-focused Nintendo Direct of 2026 is expected in February.

items.title: Ubisoft Announces Shift Toward 'Gamer-Centric' Strategy Amid Game Cancellations
items.summary: Ubisoft declared plans to become more 'gamer-centric' through game cancellations, developer layoffs, and increased AI integration, continuing its pattern of customer-hostile decisions.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Microsoft 365 Services Disrupted and Restored After Widespread Outage
items.summary: Microsoft 365 experienced a widespread outage affecting multiple services, which has now been resolved. The incident highlights ongoing challenges in cloud service reliability.

items.title: US Tech Data Centers Activated as Emergency Grid Backstop Amid Winter Storm
items.summary: Tech data centers in the US are being pulled into service as an emergency power grid support measure due to threats from a winter storm. This underscores the growing role of data centers in national infrastructure resilience.

items.title: Capital One to Acquire Brex in $5.15 Billion Deal
items.summary: Capital One announced a landmark $5.15 billion acquisition of fintech firm Brex to expand its business banking offerings. The deal marks significant consolidation in the fintech sector.

items.title: JP Morgan Acquires WealthOS to Enhance Pensions Platform
items.summary: JP Morgan has acquired WealthOS to bolster its pensions and retirement offerings. This move aims to strengthen its position in wealth management technology.

items.title: Airwallex Enters South Korea via Paynuri Acquisition
items.summary: Fintech company Airwallex has acquired Paynuri to expand into the South Korean market. The acquisition supports its global cross-border payment ambitions.

items.title: Anduril Commits $1 Billion to New California Campus
items.summary: Defense tech startup Anduril plans a $1 billion investment in a new Long Beach, California campus for advanced systems development. This expands its role in the defense technology sector.

items.title: Société Générale to Cut 1,800 Jobs in France
items.summary: Société Générale announced plans to eliminate 1,800 jobs in France as part of cost-cutting measures. The layoffs reflect broader challenges in the banking industry.
